properties.Name: Haarla wetland
properties.Details: Haarla detailed plan was approved in 2002, and the storm water solution was initially built as a pond in 2004. After several complaints from residents who saw the pond as unsafe for their children, the dam was transformed into a wetland.

properties.Name: Syvälahti swale
properties.Details: The Syvälahti swale in Hirvensalo which was built in 2015. The swale, next to the Syvälahti School, has a double function. Besides its stormwater drainage use, it works also as an overflow area for both stormwater and seawater floods.

properties.Name: Skanssikatu infiltration trenches
properties.Details: The infiltration trenches and swales situated along the street capture the surface runoff, filter it and discharging into the city’s drainage system. A study is being conducted to test the use of water resistant plants as part of stormwater solutions.

properties.Name: Jaaninoja stream restoration
properties.Details: The stream restoration, aimed also at the creation of a park around the stream to improve water quality and biodiversity in the area. The result is a multifunctional open drainage system that brings several recreational and natural values to the site.

properties.Name: Urban Stormwater Risk
properties.Details: The project improves and promotes urban water management through a twinning pilot project. The pilots in Finland and China will compare laws, regulations and policies and improve urban hydrological and water quality monitoring and risk management.
